revision.text:
{{Infobox military unit |unit_name= 198th Division (1949–53)
198th Infantry Division(1953-60)
198th Army Division(1960-61) |image= |caption= |dates= 1949.2 - 1961.5 |country= [[People's Republic of China]] |allegiance= |branch= [[People's Liberation Army]], [[People's Volunteer Army]] |type= Division |role= Infantry |size= |command_structure= [[66th Corps (People's Liberation Army)|66th Corps]] |subordinate= |garrison= |nickname= |patron= |motto= |colors= |march= |mascot= |battles= [[Chinese Civil War]], [[Korean War]] |anniversaries= |decorations= | battle_honours = |notable_commanders= |current_commander= }} The '''198th Division'''({{zh|第198师}}) was created in February 1949 under ''the Regulation of the Redesignations of All Organizations and Units of the Army'', issued by Central Military Commission on November 1, 1948,《中央军委关于统一全军组织及部队番号的规定》, http://blog.sina.com.cn/s/blog_7254c7350100xb56.html basing on the 3rd Brigade, 1st Column, 3rd Army Group of Huabei Military Region. Its origin could be traced to 4th Independent Brigade of Jicha Military District formed in June 1946. The division was a component of the [[66th Corps (People's Liberation Army)|66th Corps]]. Under the flag of 198th division it took part in the [[Chinese civil war]]. In October 1950 the division entered Korea as a part of [[People's Volunteer Army]] with a standard strength of approximately 10,000 men, consisting of the [[592nd Regiment (People's Republic of China)|592nd]], [[593rd Regiment (People's Republic of China)|593rd]], and [[594th Regiment (People's Republic of China)|594th]] Regiments.{{cite book| chapterurl = http://www.history.army.mil/books/korea/20-2-1/sn39.htm | last = Appleman| first= Roy E.| title = South to the Naktong, North to the Yalu| page = 768| chapter = XXXIX The Big Question| series = United States Army in Korea| publisher = [[United States Army Center of Military History]]| year = 1992| url = http://www.history.army.mil/books/korea/20-2-1/toc.htm| id = CMH Pub 20-2-1}} In March 1951 the division pulled back from Korea. In September 403rd Tank Self-Propelled Artillery Regiment and 592nd Artillery Regiment were activated and attached to the division.50年代我军步兵师属坦克自行火炮团的组建和发展沿革, http://www.360doc.com/content/12/0203/16/1215760_183906874.shtml By 1960 the division was composed of: *592nd Infantry Regiment; *593rd Infantry Regiment; *594th Infantry Regiment; *403rd Tank Self-Propelled Artillery Regiment; *592nd Artillery Regiment. In May 1961 the division was disbanded, and the divisional HQ was transferred to the [[People's Liberation Army Navy|Navy]]. ==References== {{reflist}} *中国人民解放军各步兵师沿革，http://blog.sina.com.cn/s/blog_a3f74a990101cp1q.html {{People's Liberation Army Divisions}} {{DEFAULTSORT:198th Division (People's Republic Of China)}} [[Category:Infantry divisions of the People's Volunteer Army|InfDiv0198China]] [[Category:Infantry divisions of the People's Liberation Army]]
